answer: The RIMH models, which arise from SUSY SO(10) grand unified theories, provide a promising way to reconcile naturalness with a decoupling solution to the SUSY flavor and CP problems (hep-ph/0102156).
explanation: This paper directly addresses the RIMH models and their ability to solve the SUSY flavor and CP problems within the context of SUSY SO(10) grand unified theories.
evidence_quote: RIMH models arise naturally within the context of SUSY SO(10) grand unified theories
